abstract: Lawrence Ellison, the head of Oracle, said Hewlett-Packard’s decision to remove Mark Hurd was not in the best interest of “employees, shareholders, customers and partners.”
snippet: Lawrence Ellison, the head of Oracle, said Hewlett-Packard’s decision to remove Mark Hurd was not in the best interest of “employees, shareholders, customers and partners.”
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Lawrence J. Ellison, the chief executive of Oracle, denounced Hewlett-Packard’s directors on Monday for forcing the resignation of the H.P. chief executive, Mark V. Hurd, who is a friend of Mr. Ellison’s.

headline.main: Oracle Chief Faults H.P. Board for Forcing Hurd Out
headline.print_headline: Oracle Chief Faults H.P. Board for Forcing Hurd Out

abstract: Lawrence Ellison, the head of Oracle, said Hewlett-Packard’s decision to remove Mark Hurd was not in the best interest of “employees, shareholders, customers and partners.”
snippet: Lawrence Ellison, the head of Oracle, said Hewlett-Packard’s decision to remove Mark Hurd was not in the best interest of “employees, shareholders, customers and partners.”
lead_paragraph: Lawrence J. Ellison, the chief executive of Oracle, denounced Hewlett-Packard’s directors on Monday for forcing the resignation of the H.P. chief executive, Mark V. Hurd, who is a friend of Mr. Ellison’s, The New York Times’s Ashlee Vance reports from San Francisco.

headline.main: Oracle Chief Faults H.P. Board for Forcing Hurd Out
